title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.4: HEALTH EPIDEMICS

description.narrative: Communities and health facilities in targeted health zones have capacity for preparedness and response to health epidemics and emergencies., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care (Covid), Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, more children, adolescents and mothers benefit from quality health interventions, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities and health facilities in targeted health zones have capacity for preparedness and response to health epidemics andemergencies.

description.narrative: Much progress has been made in epidemic control in 2021. DRC remains certified free of WPV with a reduction of cVDPV2 cases from 89 cases to;11;in 2021.; The main achievements of the year are the declaration of the end of the 12th and 13th Ebola outbreaks, the control of meningitis epidemic with 162,518 (1-49) vaccinated (110.6%),;the reduction of measles cases;80,450;in 2021;to 56,616;(S47) with 1,180,268 children aged 1-14 years (99.98%) vaccinated,;the reduction of cholera mortality rate from 2% to 1.8% and;the ongoing response against COVID.; Controlling COVID-19 and measles cases are;the major challenges for the coming year. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
